info.description: Provides ways to manage Bare Metal Solution hardware installed in a regional extension located near a Google Cloud data center.
info.title: Bare Metal Solution API

post.description: Disable the interactive serial console feature on a specific machine.

parameters.description: Required. Name of the instance to disable the interactive serial console feature on.
parameters.name: instance

post.description: Enable the interactive serial console feature on a specific machine.

parameters.description: Required. Name of the instance to enable the interactive serial console feature on.
parameters.name: instance

get.description: Read the most recent serial port output from a machine.

parameters.description: Required. Name of the instance to get serial port output of.
parameters.name: instance

parameters.description: Optional. The start byte of the serial port output to return.
parameters.name: startByte

post.description: Perform an ungraceful, hard reset on a machine (equivalent to physically turning power off and then back on).

parameters.description: Required. Name of the instance to reset.
parameters.name: instance

delete.description: Delete an SSH key registration in the specified project.

parameters.description: Required. The name of the SSH key to delete.
parameters.name: name

get.description: Get details for a specific snapshot schedule policy

parameters.description: Required. The name of the policy to retrieve.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Output only. The name of this SnapshotSchedulePolicy.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: The list of fields to update.
parameters.name: updateMask

parameters.description: Required. Name of the VolumeSnapshot to restore.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Required. The location to list Instances in.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description: Required. The location to list Luns in.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.
parameters.name: pageToken

get.description: List the budget details to provision resources on a given project.

parameters.description: Required. The parent project containing the provisioning quotas.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.
parameters.name: pageToken

get.description: List the snapshot schedule policies for the specified project

parameters.description: Required. The parent project containing the Snapshot Schedule Policies.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description: Required. The parent project containing the SnapshotSchedulePolicy.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: Required. Snapshot policy ID
parameters.name: snapshotSchedulePolicyId

get.description: List the Snapshots for the specified Volume

parameters.description: Required. The Volume containing the VolumeSnapshots.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.
parameters.name: pageToken

post.description: Create snapshot of the specified Volume

parameters.description: Required. The Volume containing the VolumeSnapshots.
parameters.name: parent

get.description: List the public SSH keys registered for the specified project.

parameters.description: Required. The parent project containing the SSH keys.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.
parameters.name: pageToken

post.description: Create a new SSH key registration in the specified project.

parameters.description: Required. The parent project containing the SSH keys.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: Required. The ID to use for the key, which will become the final component of the key's resource name. This value should be match the regex: [a-zA-Z0-9@.\-_]{1,64}
parameters.name: sshKeyId

get.description: List the volumes for the specified project

parameters.description: Required. The location to list Volumes in.
parameters.name: parent

parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The next_page_token value returned from a previous List request, if any.
parameters.name: pageToken

post.description: Submit a provisiong configuration for a given project.

parameters.description: Required. The target project of the provisioning request.
parameters.name: project

parameters.description: Required. The target location of the provisioning request.
parameters.name: location

post.description: Sets the specified snapshot schedule policy on the specified volume.

parameters.description: Required. Name of the volume to set snapshot schedule policy on.
parameters.name: volume

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.
fields.name: fields

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.
key.name: key

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.
oauth_token.name: oauth_token

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.
prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.
quotaUser.name: quotaUser

Empty.description: A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request or the response type of an API method. For instance: service Foo { rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty); } The JSON representation for `Empty` is empty JSON object `{}`.

hyperthreadingEnabled.description: Is hyperthreading enabled for this instance?

luns.description: The Luns attached to this instance

name.description: Output only. The name of this Instance.

sshEnabled.description: Is SSH enabled for this instance?

InstanceConfig.description: Configuration parameters for a new instance.

hyperthreading.description: Whether the instance should be provisioned with Hyperthreading enabled.

id.description: A transient unique identifier to idenfity an instance within an ProvisioningConfig request.

location.description: Location where to deploy the instance.

osImage.description: OS image to initialize the instance.

userNote.description: User note field, it can be used by customers to add additional information for the BMS Ops team (b/194021617).

availableMachineCount.description: Number of machines than can be created for the given location and instance_type.

nextPageToken.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are no more results in the list.
Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are no more results in the list.
Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are no more results in the list.

provisioningQuotas.description: The provisioning quotas registered in this project.

nextPageToken.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are no more results in the list.

sshKeys.description: The SSH keys registered in this project.

nextPageToken.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are no more results in the list.

snapshotSchedulePolicies.description: The snapshot schedule policies registered in this project.

nextPageToken.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are no more results in the list.
Token to retrieve the next page of results, or empty if there are no more results in the list.

volumes.description: The volumes registered in this project.

isBoot.description: Whether this Lun is a boot Lun.

multiprotocolType.description: The multiprotocol type of this Lun.

name.description: Output only. The name of this Lun.

remoteVolume.description: The storage volume that this Lun is attached to.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of this Lun

shareable.description: Whether this Lun is allowed to be shared between multiple physical servers.

sizeGb.description: The size of this Lun, in gigabytes.

wwid.description: World Wide IDentifier of this Lun

sizeGb.description: The requested size of each LUN, in GB.

address.description: IP address to be assigned to the server.

networkId.description: Id of the network to use, within the same ProvisioningConfig request.

NetworkConfig.description: Configuration parameters for a new network.

bandwidth.description: Interconnect bandwidth. Set only when type is CLIENT.

id.description: A transient unique identifier to identify a volume within an ProvisioningConfig request.

location.description: Location where to deploy the network.

userNote.description: User note field, it can be used by customers to add additional information for the BMS Ops team (b/194021617).

vlanAttachments.description: List of VLAN attachments. As of now there are always 2 attachments, but it is going to change in the future (multi vlan).

machineId.description: A single machine, identified by an ID.

networkId.description: Network to use to publish the export.

ticketId.description: A reference to track the request.

ProvisioningQuota.description: A provisioning quota for a given project.

SSHKey.description: A public SSH key registered in the project. Used primarily for the interactive serial console feature.

name.description: Output only. The name of this SSH key.

crontabSpec.description: The crontab-like specification that this Schedule will use to take snapshots.

prefix.description: A string to prefix names of snapshots created under this Schedule.

retentionCount.description: The maximum number of snapshots to retain under this Schedule.

nextStartByte.description: The byte index to use in a subsequent call to ReadSerialPortOutput to get more output.

start.description: The start byte index of the included contents.

snapshotSchedulePolicy.description: Required. The name of the policy to set on the volume.

name.description: Output only. The name of this SnapshotSchedulePolicy.

schedules.description: The snapshot Schedules contained in this Policy. At most 5 Schedules may be specified.

volumes.description: The names of the Volumes this policy is associated with.

autoGrownSizeGb.description: The size, in GB, that this Volume has expanded as a result of an auto grow policy.

currentSizeGb.description: The current size of this Volume, in GB, including space reserved for snapshots. This size may be different than the requested size if the Volume has been configured with auto grow or auto shrink.

name.description: Output only. The name of this Volume.

remainingSpaceGb.description: The space remaining in the Volume for new LUNs, in GB, excluding space reserved for snapshots.

requestedSizeGb.description: The requested size of this Volume, in GB.

snapshotAutoDeleteBehavior.description: The behavior to use when snapshot reserved space is full.

snapshotReservedSpacePercent.description: The percent of space on this Volume reserved for snapshots.

snapshotReservedSpaceRemainingGb.description: The amount, in GB, of space available in this Volume's reserved snapshot space.

snapshotReservedSpaceUsedPercent.description: The percent of reserved snapshot space on this Volume that is actually used by snapshot copies. This may be higher than 100% if snapshot copies are occupying more space than has been reserved on the Volume.

VolumeConfig.description: Configuration parameters for a new volume.

id.description: A transient unique identifier to identify a volume within an ProvisioningConfig request.

location.description: Location where to deploy the volume.

lunRanges.description: LUN ranges to be configured. Set only when protocol is PROTOCOL_FC.

machineIds.description: Machine ids connected to this volume. Set only when protocol is PROTOCOL_FC.

nfsExports.description: NFS exports. Set only when protocol is PROTOCOL_NFS.

sizeGb.description: The requested size of this volume, in GB. This will be updated in a later iteration with a generic size field.

userNote.description: User note field, it can be used by customers to add additional information for the BMS Ops team (b/194021617).

creationTime.description: The creation time of this Snapshot.

name.description: Output only. The name of this Snapshot.

sizeBytes.description: The real size of this Snapshot, in bytes.

scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl: See, edit, configure, and delete your Google Cloud data and see the email address for your Google Account.
See, edit, configure, and delete your Google Cloud data and see the email address for your Google Account.
